Key Match Events: Tyrone Taylor crossed the plate with the go-ahead run in the top of the ninth
Jose Iglesias' RBI single in the ninth gave the Mets their final lead
Edwin Diaz got three outs in the bottom of the ninth for the save
Pete Alonso hit a solo home run in the second inning
Randal Grichuk blasted a two-run homer in the third inning for the Diamondbacks
Francisco Lindor hit a home run in the sixth inning
J.D. Martinez singled leading off the seventh inning
Luis Torrens struck out with J.D. Martinez on third base
Joc Pederson walked with two outs in the eighth inning but was thrown out stealing second
Pre-Game Insights: The Mets went 6-4 over 10 straight games against strong playoff contenders
Manager Carlos Mendoza emphasized resilience and letting each day be its own thing
Post-Match Reflections: David Peterson praised the team's resilience and ability to let each day be its own thing
Mendoza expressed pride in the team's resilience after the comeback win
Miscellaneous Highlights: Pete Alonso hit his 221st home run, moving him to third place on the Mets' all-time list behind Darryl Strawberry and David Wright
